Reviews.Title: The Q-See QT548 has been a great security DVR for us, and I am very pleased with it 1 year later.
Reviews.Author: B. Brumfield
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a balance between price, channels, camera quality, and Mac support, and the Q-See QT548 fit all the requirements. I have had it installed for a year now, and it is functioning as well as the first day. We have relied heavily on this system, following a break-in at our home, the features, alarm/motion capability, and ability to tie it in with our existing alarm system, has provided a level of peace to us that is priceless.On the negative side, it seems that this version does not get updated - at least I have not seen them improve upon the software or firmware at all since we installed it, but that said, it has been working very well as-is. The iPhone app works very well, and fills the gaps created by the lack of Active-X web controls (windows-only) on the Mac, even though the Mac browser interface works for most things, it does not control all of the features like the click-and-drag-and-drop time range settings for the alarms and schedulers. I have to do all of that through the console or the iPhone app, but that's okay.I bought a $5 18" LCD monitor from Goodwill and dedicated it to the Q-SEE system, and mounted it all on a rack in our basement, so that we can interact with it directly if needed.It has been a true value to us.

ProductInfo.Features:
Real Time Full D1 Recording Resolution
8 Channel DVR / Pre-installed hard drive 1TB
Remote internet monitoring (up to 10 users at the same time)
Mobile Phone Surveillance
Compatible with MAC and PC
ProductInfo.Name: Q-See 8 Channel H.264 1TB Security DVR w/ HDMI output QT548-1
